elements.name: abstract
elements.desc: contains a summary or formal abstract prefixed to an existing source document by the encoder.

elements.name: additional
elements.desc: groups additional information, combining bibliographic information about a manuscript or other object, or surrogate copies of it, with curatorial or administrative information.

elements.name: address
elements.group: model_phrase model_limitedPhrase model_pPart_data model_correspActionPart model_addressLike model_publicationStmtPart_detail
elements.desc: contains a postal address, for example of a publisher, an organization, or an individual.

elements.name: adminInfo
elements.desc: contains information about the present custody and availability of the manuscript or other object, and also about the record description itself.

elements.name: altIdentifier
elements.desc: contains an alternative or former structured identifier used for a manuscript or other object, such as a former catalogue number.

elements.name: argument
elements.desc: contains a formal list or prose description of the topics addressed by a subdivision of a text.

elements.name: availability
elements.desc: supplies information about the availability of a text, for example any restrictions on its use or distribution, its copyright status, any licence applying to it, etc.

elements.name: back
elements.desc: contains any appendixes, etc. following the main part of a text.

elements.name: biblFull
elements.content: (((titleStmt editionStmt? extent? publicationStmt seriesStmt? notesStmt?) sourceDesc*)|(fileDesc profileDesc))
elements.group: model_common model_inter model_personPart model_msItemPart model_standOffPart model_biblLike
elements.desc: contains a fully-structured bibliographic citation, in which all components of the TEI file description are present.

elements.name: binding
elements.desc: contains a description of one binding, i.e. type of covering, boards, etc. applied to a manuscript or other object.

elements.name: bindingDesc
elements.desc: describes the present and former bindings of a manuscript or other object, either as a series of paragraphs or as a series of distinct binding elements, one for each binding of the manuscript.

elements.name: body
elements.desc: contains the whole body of a single unitary text, excluding any front or back matter.

elements.name: castGroup
elements.desc: groups one or more individual castItem elements within a cast list.

elements.name: castList
elements.desc: contains a single cast list or dramatis personae.

elements.name: category
elements.desc: contains an individual descriptive category, possibly nested within a superordinate category, within a user-defined taxonomy.

elements.name: cit
elements.group: model_common model_inter model_qLike model_msItemPart model_quoteLike model_entryPart_top
elements.desc: contains a quotation from some other document, together with a bibliographic reference to its source. In a dictionary it may contain an example text with at least one occurrence of the word form, used in the sense being described, or a translation of the headword, or an example.

elements.name: classDecl
elements.desc: contains one or more taxonomies defining any classificatory codes used elsewhere in the text.

elements.name: custodialHist
elements.desc: contains a description of a manuscript or other object's custodial history, either as running prose or as a series of dated custodial events.

elements.name: decoDesc
elements.desc: contains a description of the decoration of a manuscript or other object, either as in paragraphs, or as one or more decoNote elements.

elements.name: dimensions
elements.desc: contains a dimensional specification.

elements.name: div
elements.desc: contains a subdivision of the front, body, or back of a text.

elements.name: docTitle
elements.desc: contains the title of a document, including all its constituents, as given on a title page.

elements.name: editionStmt
elements.desc: groups information relating to one edition of a text.

elements.name: editorialDecl
elements.desc: provides details of editorial principles and practices applied during the encoding of a text.

elements.name: encodingDesc
elements.desc: documents the relationship between an electronic text and the source or sources from which it was derived.

elements.name: epigraph
elements.desc: contains a quotation, anonymous or attributed, appearing at the start or end of a section or on a title page.

elements.name: fileDesc
elements.content: ((titleStmt editionStmt? extent? publicationStmt seriesStmt? notesStmt?) sourceDesc+)
elements.desc: contains a full bibliographic description of an electronic file.

elements.name: floatingText
elements.desc: contains a single text of any kind, whether unitary or composite, which interrupts the text containing it at any point and after which the surrounding text resumes.

elements.name: front
elements.desc: contains any prefatory matter (headers, abstracts, title page, prefaces, dedications, etc.) found at the start of a document, before the main body.

elements.name: handDesc
elements.desc: contains a description of all the different hands used in a manuscript or other object.

elements.name: history
elements.desc: groups elements describing the full history of a manuscript, manuscript part, or other object.

elements.name: imprint
elements.desc: groups information relating to the publication or distribution of a bibliographic item.

elements.name: keywords
elements.desc: contains a list of keywords or phrases identifying the topic or nature of a text.

elements.name: langUsage
elements.desc: describes the languages, sublanguages, registers, dialects, etc. represented within a text.

elements.name: layoutDesc
elements.desc: collects the set of layout descriptions applicable to a manuscript or other object.

elements.name: lg
elements.desc: contains one or more verse lines functioning as a formal unit, e.g. a stanza, refrain, verse paragraph, etc.

elements.name: list
elements.desc: contains any sequence of items organized as a list.

elements.name: listBibl
elements.group: model_frontPart model_common model_inter model_personPart model_msItemPart model_standOffPart model_biblLike
elements.desc: contains a list of bibliographic citations of any kind.

elements.name: listChange
elements.desc: groups a number of change descriptions associated with either the creation of a source text or the revision of an encoded text.

elements.name: listPerson
elements.desc: contains a list of descriptions, each of which provides information about an identifiable person or a group of people, for example the participants in a language interaction, or the people referred to in a historical source.

elements.name: listPlace
elements.desc: contains a list of places, optionally followed by a list of relationships (other than containment) defined amongst them.

elements.name: listPrefixDef
elements.desc: contains a list of definitions of prefixing schemes used in data.pointer values, showing how abbreviated URIs using each scheme may be expanded into full URIs.

elements.name: locusGrp
elements.desc: groups a number of locations which together form a distinct but discontinuous item within a manuscript, manuscript part, or other object.

elements.name: msContents
elements.desc: describes the intellectual content of a manuscript, manuscript part, or other object either as a series of paragraphs or as a series of structured manuscript items.

elements.name: msDesc
elements.group: model_common model_inter model_personPart model_msItemPart model_standOffPart model_biblLike
elements.desc: contains a description of a single identifiable manuscript or other text-bearing object such as early printed books.

elements.name: msFrag
elements.desc: contains information about a fragment described in relation to a prior context, typically as a description of a virtual reconstruction of a manuscript or other object whose fragments were catalogued separately

elements.name: msIdentifier
elements.desc: contains the information required to identify the manuscript or similar object being described.

elements.name: msItem
elements.desc: describes an individual work or item within the intellectual content of a manuscript, manuscript part, or other object.

elements.name: msItemStruct
elements.content: ((locus|locusGrp)? (model_pLike+|(author* respStmt* title* rubric? incipit? msItemStruct* explicit? finalRubric? colophon* decoNote* listBibl* (bibl)* filiation? model_noteLike*)))
elements.desc: contains a structured description for an individual work or item within the intellectual content of a manuscript, manuscript part, or other object.

elements.name: msPart
elements.desc: contains information about an originally distinct manuscript or part of a manuscript, which is now part of a composite manuscript.

elements.name: namespace
elements.desc: supplies the formal name of the namespace to which the elements documented by its children belong.

elements.name: notesStmt
elements.desc: collects together any notes providing information about a text additional to that recorded in other parts of the bibliographic description.

elements.name: objectDesc
elements.desc: contains a description of the physical components making up the object which is being described.

elements.name: person
elements.desc: provides information about an identifiable individual, for example a participant in a language interaction, or a person referred to in a historical source.

elements.name: place
elements.desc: contains data about a geographic location

elements.name: physDesc
elements.desc: contains a full physical description of a manuscript, manuscript part, or other object optionally subdivided using more specialized elements from the model.physDescPart class.

elements.name: particDesc
elements.desc: describes the identifiable speakers, voices, or other participants in any kind of text or other persons named or otherwise referred to in a text, edition, or metadata.

elements.name: postscript
elements.desc: contains a postscript, e.g. to a letter.

elements.name: projectDesc
elements.desc: describes in detail the aim or purpose for which an electronic file was encoded, together with any other relevant information concerning the process by which it was assembled or collected.

elements.name: prefixDef
elements.desc: defines a prefixing scheme used in data.pointer values, showing how abbreviated URIs using the scheme may be expanded into full URIs.

elements.name: profileDesc
elements.desc: provides a detailed description of non-bibliographic aspects of a text, specifically the languages and sublanguages used, the situation in which it was produced, the participants and their setting.

elements.name: publicationStmt
elements.desc: groups information concerning the publication or distribution of an electronic or other text.

elements.name: recordHist
elements.desc: provides information about the source and revision status of the parent manuscript or object description itself.

elements.name: relatedItem
elements.desc: contains or references some other bibliographic item which is related to the present one in some specified manner, for example as a constituent or alternative version of it.

elements.name: respStmt
elements.desc: supplies a statement of responsibility for the intellectual content of a text, edition, recording, or series, where the specialized elements for authors, editors, etc. do not suffice or do not apply. May also be used to encode information about individuals or organizations which have played a role in the production or distribution of a bibliographic work.

elements.name: revisionDesc
elements.desc: summarizes the revision history for a file.

elements.name: scriptDesc
elements.desc: contains a description of the scripts used in a manuscript or other object.

elements.name: seriesStmt
elements.desc: groups information about the series, if any, to which a publication belongs.

elements.name: seal
elements.desc: contains a description of one seal or similar applied to the object described

elements.name: sealDesc
elements.desc: describes the seals or similar items related to the object described, either as a series of paragraphs or as a series of seal elements.

elements.name: set
elements.desc: contains a description of the setting, time, locale, appearance, etc., of the action of a play, typically found in the front matter of a printed performance text (not a stage direction).

elements.name: sourceDesc
elements.desc: describes the source(s) from which an electronic text was derived or generated, typically a bibliographic description in the case of a digitized text, or a phrase such as "born digital" for a text which has no previous existence.

elements.name: supportDesc
elements.desc: groups elements describing the physical support for the written part of a manuscript or other object.

elements.name: sp
elements.desc: contains an individual speech in a performance text, or a passage presented as such in a prose or verse text.

elements.name: titlePage
elements.desc: contains the title page of a text, appearing within the front or back matter.

elements.name: titleStmt
elements.desc: groups information about the title of a work and those responsible for its content.

elements.name: typeDesc
elements.desc: contains a description of the typefaces or other aspects of the printing of an incunable or other printed source.

elements.name: refsDecl
elements.desc: specifies how canonical references are constructed for this text.

elements.name: samplingDecl
elements.desc: contains a prose description of the rationale and methods used in sampling texts in the creation of a corpus or collection.

elements.name: tagsDecl
elements.desc: provides detailed information about the tagging applied to a document.

elements.name: taxonomy
elements.desc: defines a typology either implicitly, by means of a bibliographic citation, or explicitly by a structured taxonomy.

elements.name: settingDesc
elements.desc: describes the setting or settings within which a language interaction takes place, or other places otherwise referred to in a text, edition, or metadata.

elements.name: anchor
elements.desc: attaches an identifier to a point within a text, whether or not it corresponds with a textual element.

elements.name: cb
elements.desc: marks the beginning of a new column of a text on a multi-column page.

elements.name: catRef
elements.desc: specifies one or more defined categories within some taxonomy or text typology.

elements.name: gap
elements.desc: indicates a point where material has been omitted in a transcription, whether for editorial reasons described in the TEI header, as part of sampling practice, or because the material is illegible, invisible, or inaudible.

elements.name: lb
elements.desc: marks the beginning of a new (typographic) line in some edition or version of a text.

elements.name: milestone
elements.desc: marks a boundary point separating any kind of section of a text, typically but not necessarily indicating a point at which some part of a standard reference system changes, where the change is not represented by a structural element.

elements.name: pb
elements.desc: marks the beginning of a new page in a paginated document.

elements.name: note
elements.desc: contains a note or annotation.

elements.name: choice
elements.desc: groups a number of alternative encodings for the same point in a text.

elements.name: fw
elements.desc: contains a running head (e.g. a header, footer), catchword, or similar material appearing on the current page.

elements.name: subst
elements.desc: groups one or more deletions with one or more additions when the combination is to be regarded as a single intervention in the text.

elements.name: markadd
elements.desc: contains letters, words, or phrases inserted in the source text by an author, scribe, or a previous annotator or corrector.

elements.name: add
elements.desc: contains letters, words, or phrases inserted in the source text by an author, scribe, or a previous annotator or corrector.

elements.name: markcorr
elements.desc: contains the correct form of a passage apparently erroneous in the copy text.

elements.name: corr
elements.desc: contains the correct form of a passage apparently erroneous in the copy text.

elements.name: markdel
elements.desc: contains a letter, word, or passage deleted, marked as deleted, or otherwise indicated as superfluous or spurious in the copy text by an author, scribe, or a previous annotator or corrector.

elements.name: del
elements.desc: contains a letter, word, or passage deleted, marked as deleted, or otherwise indicated as superfluous or spurious in the copy text by an author, scribe, or a previous annotator or corrector.

elements.name: markhi
elements.desc: marks a word or phrase as graphically distinct from the surrounding text, for reasons concerning which no claim is made.

elements.name: hi
elements.desc: marks a word or phrase as graphically distinct from the surrounding text, for reasons concerning which no claim is made.

elements.name: markorig
elements.desc: contains a reading which is marked as following the original, rather than being normalized or corrected.

elements.name: orig
elements.desc: contains a reading which is marked as following the original, rather than being normalized or corrected.

elements.name: markq
elements.desc: contains material which is distinguished from the surrounding text using quotation marks or a similar method, for any one of a variety of reasons including, but not limited to: direct speech or thought, technical terms or jargon, authorial distance, quotations from elsewhere, and passages that are mentioned but not used.

elements.name: q
elements.desc: contains material which is distinguished from the surrounding text using quotation marks or a similar method, for any one of a variety of reasons including, but not limited to: direct speech or thought, technical terms or jargon, authorial distance, quotations from elsewhere, and passages that are mentioned but not used.

elements.name: markquote
elements.desc: contains a phrase or passage attributed by the narrator or author to some agency external to the text.

elements.name: quote
elements.desc: contains a phrase or passage attributed by the narrator or author to some agency external to the text.

elements.name: markref
elements.desc: defines a reference to another location, possibly modified by additional text or comment.

elements.name: ref
elements.desc: defines a reference to another location, possibly modified by additional text or comment.

elements.name: markreg
elements.desc: contains a reading which has been regularized or normalized in some sense.

elements.name: reg
elements.desc: contains a reading which has been regularized or normalized in some sense.

elements.name: markrhyme
elements.desc: marks the rhyming part of a metrical line.

elements.name: rhyme
elements.desc: marks the rhyming part of a metrical line.

elements.name: markseg
elements.desc: represents any segmentation of text below the chunk level.

elements.name: seg
elements.desc: represents any segmentation of text below the chunk level.

elements.name: marksic
elements.desc: contains text reproduced although apparently incorrect or inaccurate.

elements.name: sic
elements.desc: contains text reproduced although apparently incorrect or inaccurate.

elements.name: marksignatures
elements.desc: contains discussion of the leaf or quire signatures found within a codex or similar object.

elements.name: signatures
elements.desc: contains discussion of the leaf or quire signatures found within a codex or similar object.

elements.name: marksupplied
elements.desc: signifies text supplied by the transcriber or editor for any reason; for example because the original cannot be read due to physical damage, or because of an obvious omission by the author or scribe.

elements.name: supplied
elements.desc: signifies text supplied by the transcriber or editor for any reason; for example because the original cannot be read due to physical damage, or because of an obvious omission by the author or scribe.

elements.name: markunclear
elements.desc: contains a word, phrase, or passage which cannot be transcribed with certainty because it is illegible or inaudible in the source.

elements.name: unclear
elements.desc: contains a word, phrase, or passage which cannot be transcribed with certainty because it is illegible or inaudible in the source.

elements.name: abbr
elements.desc: contains an abbreviation of any sort.

elements.name: c
elements.desc: represents a character.

elements.name: g
elements.desc: represents a glyph, or a non-standard character.

elements.name: pc
elements.desc: contains a character or string of characters regarded as constituting a single punctuation mark.

elements.name: w
elements.desc: represents a grammatical (not necessarily orthographic) word.

elements.name: catchwords
elements.desc: describes the system used to ensure correct ordering of the quires or similar making up a codex, incunable, or other object typically by means of annotations at the foot of the page.

elements.name: date
elements.group: model_phrase model_limitedPhrase model_pPart_data model_recordingPart model_correspActionPart model_dateLike model_publicationStmtPart_detail
elements.desc: contains a date in any format.

elements.name: email
elements.desc: contains an email address identifying a location to which email messages can be delivered.

elements.name: expan
elements.desc: contains the expansion of an abbreviation.

elements.name: foreign
elements.desc: identifies a word or phrase as belonging to some language other than that of the surrounding text.

elements.name: heraldry
elements.desc: contains a heraldic formula or phrase, typically found as part of a blazon, coat of arms, etc.

elements.name: material
elements.desc: contains a word or phrase describing the material of which the object being described is composed.

elements.name: measure
elements.desc: contains a word or phrase referring to some quantity of an object or commodity, usually comprising a number, a unit, and a commodity name.

elements.name: name
elements.group: model_addrPart model_phrase model_limitedPhrase model_pPart_data model_correspActionPart model_nameLike model_nameLike_agent model_personPart
elements.desc: contains a proper noun or noun phrase.

elements.name: num
elements.desc: contains a number, written in any form.

elements.name: objectType
elements.desc: contains a word or phrase describing the type of object being referred to.

elements.name: origDate
elements.desc: contains any form of date, used to identify the date of origin for a manuscript, manuscript part, or other object.

elements.name: origPlace
elements.desc: contains any form of place name, used to identify the place of origin for a manuscript, manuscript part, or other object.

elements.name: rs
elements.group: model_addrPart model_phrase model_limitedPhrase model_pPart_data model_correspActionPart model_nameLike
elements.desc: contains a general purpose name or referring string.

elements.name: s
elements.desc: contains a sentence-like division of a text.

elements.name: secFol
elements.desc: marks the word or words taken from a fixed point in a codex (typically the beginning of the second leaf) in order to provide a unique identifier for it.

elements.name: stamp
elements.desc: contains a word or phrase describing a stamp or similar device.

elements.name: term
elements.desc: contains a single-word, multi-word, or symbolic designation which is regarded as a technical term.

elements.name: time
elements.group: model_phrase model_limitedPhrase model_pPart_data model_recordingPart model_correspActionPart model_dateLike
elements.desc: contains a phrase defining a time of day in any format.

elements.name: watermark
elements.desc: contains a word or phrase describing a watermark or similar device.

elements.name: ab
elements.desc: contains any arbitrary component-level unit of text, acting as an anonymous container for phrase or inter level elements analogous to, but without the semantic baggage of, a paragraph.

elements.name: actor
elements.desc: contains the name of an actor appearing within a cast list.

elements.name: accMat
elements.desc: contains details of any significant additional material which may be closely associated with the manuscript or object being described, such as non-contemporaneous documents or fragments bound in with it at some earlier historical period.

elements.name: acquisition
elements.desc: contains any descriptive or other information concerning the process by which a manuscript or manuscript part or other object entered the holding institution.

elements.name: additions
elements.desc: contains a description of any significant additions found within a manuscript or other object, such as marginalia or other annotations.

elements.name: addrLine
elements.desc: contains one line of a postal address.

elements.name: author
elements.desc: in a bibliographic reference, contains the name(s) of an author, personal or corporate, of a work; for example in the same form as that provided by a recognized bibliographic name authority.

elements.name: bibl
elements.group: model_common model_inter model_personPart model_msItemPart model_standOffPart model_biblLike model_biblPart
elements.desc: contains a loosely-structured bibliographic citation of which the sub-components may or may not be explicitly tagged.

elements.name: biblScope
elements.desc: defines the scope of a bibliographic reference, for example as a list of page numbers, or a named subdivision of a larger work.

elements.name: byline
elements.desc: contains the primary statement of responsibility given for a work on its title page or at the head or end of the work.

elements.name: castItem
elements.desc: contains a single entry within a cast list, describing either a single role or a list of non-speaking roles.

elements.name: catDesc
elements.desc: describes some category within a taxonomy or text typology, either in the form of a brief prose description or in terms of the situational parameters used by the TEI formal textDesc.

elements.name: change
elements.desc: documents a change or set of changes made during the production of a source document, or during the revision of an electronic file.

elements.name: classCode
elements.desc: contains the classification code used for this text in some standard classification system.

elements.name: closer
elements.desc: groups together salutations, datelines, and similar phrases appearing as a final group at the end of a division, especially of a letter.

elements.name: collation
elements.desc: contains a description of how the leaves, bifolia, or similar objects are physically arranged.

elements.name: collection
elements.desc: contains the name of a collection of manuscripts or other objects, not necessarily located within a single repository.

elements.name: colophon
elements.desc: contains the colophon of an item: that is, a statement providing information regarding the date, place, agency, or reason for production of the manuscript or other object.

elements.name: condition
elements.desc: contains a description of the physical condition of the manuscript or object.

elements.name: creation
elements.desc: contains information about the creation of a text.

elements.name: custEvent
elements.desc: describes a single event during the custodial history of a manuscript or other object.

elements.name: dateline
elements.desc: contains a brief description of the place, date, time, etc. of production of a letter, newspaper story, or other work, prefixed or suffixed to it as a kind of heading or trailer.

elements.name: decoNote
elements.desc: contains a note describing either a decorative component of a manuscript or other object, or a fairly homogenous class of such components.

elements.name: depth
elements.desc: contains a measurement from the front to the back of an object, perpendicular to the measurement given by the width element.

elements.name: desc
elements.desc: contains a brief description of the object documented by its parent element, typically a documentation element or an entity.

elements.name: dim
elements.desc: contains any single measurement forming part of a dimensional specification of some sort.

elements.name: distributor
elements.desc: supplies the name of a person or other agency responsible for the distribution of a text.

elements.name: docAuthor
elements.desc: contains the name of the author of the document, as given on the title page (often but not always contained in a byline).

elements.name: docDate
elements.desc: contains the date of a document, as given on a title page or in a dateline.

elements.name: docEdition
elements.desc: contains an edition statement as presented on a title page of a document.

elements.name: docImprint
elements.desc: contains the imprint statement (place and date of publication, publisher name), as given (usually) at the foot of a title page.

elements.name: edition
elements.desc: describes the particularities of one edition of a text.

elements.name: editor
elements.desc: contains a secondary statement of responsibility for a bibliographic item, for example the name of an individual, institution or organization, (or of several such) acting as editor, compiler, translator, etc.

elements.name: explicit
elements.desc: contains the explicit of a item, that is, the closing words of the text proper, exclusive of any rubric or colophon which might follow it.

elements.name: extent
elements.desc: describes the approximate size of a text stored on some carrier medium or of some other object, digital or non-digital, specified in any convenient units.

elements.name: filiation
elements.desc: contains information concerning the manuscript or other object's filiation, i.e. its relationship to other surviving manuscripts or other objects of the same text or contents, its protographs, antigraphs and apographs.

elements.name: finalRubric
elements.desc: contains the string of words that denotes the end of a text division, often with an assertion as to its author and title, usually set off from the text itself by red ink, by a different size or type of script, or by some other such visual device.

elements.name: foliation
elements.desc: describes the numbering system or systems used to count the leaves or pages in a codex or similar object.

elements.name: head
elements.desc: contains any type of heading, for example the title of a section, or the heading of a list, glossary, manuscript description, etc.

elements.name: height
elements.desc: contains a measurement measured along the axis at a right angle to the bottom of the object.

elements.name: idno
elements.group: model_msItemPart model_addrPart model_phrase model_limitedPhrase model_pPart_data model_correspActionPart model_nameLike model_publicationStmtPart_detail model_personPart
elements.desc: supplies any form of identifier used to identify some object, such as a bibliographic item, a person, a title, an organization, etc. in a standardized way.

elements.name: imprimatur
elements.desc: contains a formal statement authorizing the publication of a work, sometimes required to appear on a title page or its verso.

elements.name: incipit
elements.desc: contains the incipit of a manuscript or similar object item, that is the opening words of the text proper, exclusive of any rubric which might precede it, of sufficient length to identify the work uniquely; such incipits were, in former times, frequently used a means of reference to a work, in place of a title.

elements.name: institution
elements.desc: contains the name of an organization such as a university or library, with which a manuscript or other object is identified, generally its holding institution.

elements.name: item
elements.desc: contains one component of a list.

elements.name: l
elements.desc: contains a single, possibly incomplete, line of verse.

elements.name: label
elements.desc: contains any label or heading used to identify part of a text, typically but not exclusively in a list or glossary.

elements.name: language
elements.desc: characterizes a single language or sublanguage used within a text.

elements.name: layout
elements.desc: describes how text is laid out on the page or surface of the object, including information about any ruling, pricking, or other evidence of page-preparation techniques.

elements.name: licence
elements.desc: contains information about a licence or other legal agreement applicable to the text.

elements.name: locus
elements.desc: defines a location within a manuscript, manuscript part, or other object typically as a (possibly discontinuous) sequence of folio references.

elements.name: musicNotation
elements.desc: contains description of type of musical notation.

elements.name: msName
elements.desc: contains any form of unstructured alternative name used for a manuscript or other object, such as an ocellus nominum, or nickname.

elements.name: opener
elements.desc: groups together dateline, byline, salutation, and similar phrases appearing as a preliminary group at the start of a division, especially of a letter.

elements.name: origin
elements.desc: contains any descriptive or other information concerning the origin of a manuscript, manuscript part, or other object.

elements.name: p
elements.desc: marks paragraphs in prose.

elements.name: postCode
elements.desc: contains a numerical or alphanumeric code used as part of a postal address to simplify sorting or delivery of mail.

elements.name: provenance
elements.desc: contains any descriptive or other information concerning a single identifiable episode during the history of a manuscript, manuscript part, or other object after its creation but before its acquisition.

elements.name: publisher
elements.desc: provides the name of the organization responsible for the publication or distribution of a bibliographic item.

elements.name: pubPlace
elements.desc: contains the name of the place where a bibliographic item was published.

elements.name: rendition
elements.desc: supplies information about the rendition or appearance of one or more elements in the source text.

elements.name: repository
elements.desc: contains the name of a repository within which manuscripts or other objects are stored, possibly forming part of an institution.

elements.name: resp
elements.desc: contains a phrase describing the nature of a person's intellectual responsibility, or an organization's role in the production or distribution of a work.

elements.name: role
elements.desc: contains the name of a dramatic role, as given in a cast list.

elements.name: roleDesc
elements.desc: describes a character's role in a drama.

elements.name: rubric
elements.desc: contains the text of any rubric or heading attached to a particular manuscript item, that is, a string of words through which a manuscript or other object signals the beginning of a text division, often with an assertion as to its author and title, which is in some way set off from the text itself, typically in red ink, or by use of different size or type of script, or some other such visual device.

elements.name: salute
elements.desc: contains a salutation or greeting prefixed to a foreword, dedicatory epistle, or other division of a text, or the salutation in the closing of a letter, preface, etc.

elements.name: signed
elements.desc: contains the closing salutation, etc., appended to a foreword, dedicatory epistle, or other division of a text.

elements.name: source
elements.desc: describes the original source for the information contained with a manuscript or object description.

elements.name: speaker
elements.desc: contains a specialized form of heading or label, giving the name of one or more speakers in a dramatic text or fragment.

elements.name: stage
elements.desc: contains any kind of stage direction within a dramatic text or fragment.

elements.name: street
elements.desc: contains a full street address including any name or number identifying a building as well as the name of the street or route on which it is located.

elements.name: summary
elements.desc: contains an overview of the available information concerning some aspect of an item or object (for example, its intellectual content, history, layout, typography etc.) as a complement or alternative to the more detailed information carried by more specific elements.

elements.name: support
elements.desc: contains a description of the materials etc. which make up the physical support for the written part of a manuscript or other object.

elements.name: surrogates
elements.desc: contains information about any representations of the manuscript or other object being described which may exist in the holding institution or elsewhere.

elements.name: tagUsage
elements.desc: documents the usage of a specific element within a specified document.

elements.name: title
elements.group: model_phrase model_highlighted model_limitedPhrase model_emphLike model_msItemPart model_msQuoteLike
elements.desc: contains a title for any kind of work.

elements.name: titlePart
elements.desc: contains a subsection or division of the title of a work, as indicated on a title page.

elements.name: trailer
elements.desc: contains a closing title or footer appearing at the end of a division of a text.

elements.name: typeNote
elements.desc: describes a particular font or other significant typographic feature distinguished within the description of a printed resource.

elements.name: width
elements.desc: contains a measurement of an object along the axis parallel to its bottom, e.g. perpendicular to the spine of a book or codex.

elements.name: textNode2
elements.marks: model_gLike model_highlighted model_pPart_data model_pPart_edit model_segLike model_ptrLike

xml:id.description: provides a unique identifier for the element bearing the attribute.

n.description: gives a number (or other label) for an element, which is not necessarily unique within the document.

xml:lang.description: indicates the language of the element content using a tag generated according to BCP 47.

xml:base.description: provides a base URI reference with which applications can resolve relative URI references into absolute URI references.

xml:space.description: signals an intention about how white space should be managed by applications.

valList.desc: signals that the application's default white-space processing modes are acceptable
indicates the intent that applications preserve all white space

rend.description: indicates how the element in question was rendered or presented in the source text.

style.description: contains an expression in some formal style definition language which defines the rendering or presentation used for this element in the source text

rendition.description: points to a description of the rendering or presentation used for this element in the source text.

corresp.description: points to elements that correspond to the current element in some way.

synch.description: points to elements that are synchronous with the current element.

sameAs.description: points to an element that is the same as the current element.

copyOf.description: points to an element of which the current element is a copy.

next.description: points to the next element of a virtual aggregate of which the current element is part.

prev.description: points to the previous element of a virtual aggregate of which the current element is part.

exclude.description: points to elements that are in exclusive alternation with the current element.

select.description: selects one or more alternants; if one alternant is selected, the ambiguity or uncertainty is marked as resolved. If more than one alternant is selected, the degree of ambiguity or uncertainty is marked as reduced by the number of alternants not selected.

ana.description: indicates one or more elements containing interpretations of the element on which the ana attribute appears.

facs.description: points to all or part of an image which corresponds with the content of the element.

change.description: points to one or more change elements documenting a state or revision campaign to which the element bearing this attribute and its children have been assigned by the encoder.

cert.description: signifies the degree of certainty associated with the intervention or interpretation.

resp.description: indicates the agency responsible for the intervention or interpretation, for example an editor or transcriber.

source.description: specifies the source from which some aspect of this element is drawn.

type.description: characterizes the element in some sense, using any convenient classification scheme or typology.

subtype.description: provides a sub-categorization of the element, if needed

status.description: supplies a code identifying the current availability of the text.

valList.desc: the text is freely available.
the status of the text is unknown.
the text is not freely available.

default.description: indicates whether or not this element is selected by default when its parent is selected.

valList.desc: This element is selected if its parent is selected
This element can only be selected explicitly, unless it is the only one of its kind, in which case it is selected if its parent is selected.

decls.description: identifies one or more declarable elements within the header, which are understood to apply to the element bearing this attribute and its content.

sortKey.description: supplies the sort key for this element in an index, list or group which contains it.

contemporary.description: specifies whether or not the binding is contemporary with the majority of its contents

calendar.description: indicates the system or calendar to which the date represented by the content of this element belongs.

period.description: supplies a pointer to some location defining a named period of time within which the datable item is understood to have occurred.

when.description: supplies the value of the date or time in a standard form, e.g. yyyy-mm-dd.

notBefore.description: specifies the earliest possible date for the event in standard form, e.g. yyyy-mm-dd.

notAfter.description: specifies the latest possible date for the event in standard form, e.g. yyyy-mm-dd.

from.description: indicates the starting point of the period in standard form, e.g. yyyy-mm-dd.

to.description: indicates the ending point of the period in standard form, e.g. yyyy-mm-dd.

when-iso.description: supplies the value of a date or time in a standard form.

notBefore-iso.description: specifies the earliest possible date for the event in standard form, e.g. yyyy-mm-dd.

notAfter-iso.description: specifies the latest possible date for the event in standard form, e.g. yyyy-mm-dd.

from-iso.description: indicates the starting point of the period in standard form.

to-iso.description: indicates the ending point of the period in standard form.

when-custom.description: supplies the value of a date or time in some custom standard form.

notBefore-custom.description: specifies the earliest possible date for the event in some custom standard form.

notAfter-custom.description: specifies the latest possible date for the event in some custom standard form.

from-custom.description: indicates the starting point of the period in some custom standard form.

to-custom.description: indicates the ending point of the period in some custom standard form.

datingPoint.description: supplies a pointer to some location defining a named point in time with reference to which the datable item is understood to have occurred

datingMethod.description: supplies a pointer to a calendar element or other means of interpreting the values of the custom dating attributes.

unit.description: names the unit used for the measurement

valList.desc: lines of text
characters of text

quantity.description: specifies the length in the units specified

extent.description: indicates the size of the object concerned using a project-specific vocabulary combining quantity and units in a single string of words.

precision.description: characterizes the precision of the values specified by the other attributes.

scope.description: where the measurement summarizes more than one observation, specifies the applicability of this measurement.

valList.desc: measurement applies to all instances.
measurement applies to most of the instances inspected.
measurement applies to only the specified range of instances.

atLeast.description: gives a minimum estimated value for the approximate measurement.

atMost.description: gives a maximum estimated value for the approximate measurement.

min.description: where the measurement summarizes more than one observation or a range, supplies the minimum value observed.

max.description: where the measurement summarizes more than one observation or a range, supplies the maximum value observed.

confidence.description: specifies the degree of statistical confidence (between zero and one) that a value falls within the range specified by min and max, or the proportion of observed values that fall within that range.

org.description: specifies how the content of the division is organized.

valList.desc: no claim is made about the sequence in which the immediate contents of this division are to be processed, or their inter-relationships.
the immediate contents of this element are regarded as forming a logical unit, to be processed in sequence.

sample.description: indicates whether this division is a sample of the original source and if so, from which part.

valList.desc: division lacks material present at end in source.
division lacks material at start and end.
division lacks material at start.
position of sampled material within original unknown.
division is not a sample.

met.description: contains a user-specified encoding for the conventional metrical structure of the element.

real.description: contains a user-specified encoding for the actual realization of the conventional metrical structure applicable to the element.

rhyme.description: specifies the rhyme scheme applicable to a group of verse lines.

part.description: specifies whether or not its parent element is fragmented in some way, typically by some other overlapping structure: for example a speech which is divided between two or more verse stanzas, a paragraph which is split across a page division, a verse line which is divided between two speakers.

valList.desc: the element is fragmented in some (unspecified) respect
the element is not fragmented, or no claim is made as to its completeness
this is the initial part of a fragmented element
this is a medial part of a fragmented element
this is the final part of a fragmented element

hand.description: points to a handNote element describing the hand considered responsible for the content of the element concerned.

key.description: provides an externally-defined means of identifying the entity (or entities) being named, using a coded value of some kind.

ref.description: provides an explicit means of locating a full definition or identity for the entity being named by means of one or more URIs.

hands.description: specifies the number of distinct hands identified within the manuscript

scheme.description: identifies the controlled vocabulary within which the set of keywords concerned is defined, for example by a taxonomy element, or by some other resource.

ordered.description: indicates whether the ordering of its child change elements is to be considered significant or not

defective.description: indicates whether the passage being quoted is defective, i.e. incomplete through loss or damage.

class.description: identifies the text types or classifications applicable to this item by pointing to other elements or resources defining the classification concerned.

name.description: specifies the full formal name of the namespace concerned.

form.description: a short project-specific name identifying the physical form of the carrier, for example as a codex, roll, fragment, partial leaf, cutting etc.

role.description: specifies a primary role or classification for the person.

sex.description: specifies the sex of the person.

age.description: specifies an age group for the person.

evidence.description: indicates the nature of the evidence supporting the reliability or accuracy of the intervention or interpretation.

valList.desc: there is internal evidence to support the intervention.
there is external evidence to support the intervention.
the intervention or interpretation has been made by the editor, cataloguer, or scholar on the basis of their expertise.

instant.description: indicates whether this is an instant revision or not.

ident.description: supplies a name which functions as the prefix for an abbreviated pointing scheme such as a private URI scheme. The prefix constitutes the text preceding the first colon.

matchPattern.description: specifies a regular expression against which the values of other attributes can be matched.

replacementPattern.description: specifies a replacement pattern, that is, the skeleton of a relative or absolute URI containing references to groups in the matchPattern which, once subpattern substitution has been performed, complete the URI.

target.description: points to the related bibliographic element by means of an absolute or relative URI reference

material.description: a short project-defined name for the material composing the majority of the support

toWhom.description: indicates the person, or group of people, to whom a speech act or action is directed.

who.description: indicates the person, or group of people, to whom the element content is ascribed.

partial.description: indicates whether the element types listed exhaustively include all those found within text, or represent only a subset.

ed.description: supplies a sigil or other arbitrary identifier for the source edition in which the associated feature (for example, a page, column, or line break) occurs at this point in the text.

edRef.description: provides a pointer to the source edition in which the associated feature (for example, a page, column, or line break) occurs at this point in the text.

spanTo.description: indicates the end of a span initiated by the element bearing this attribute.

break.description: indicates whether or not the element bearing this attribute should be considered to mark the end of an orthographic token in the same way as whitespace.

valList.desc: the element bearing this attribute is considered to mark the end of any adjacent orthographic token irrespective of the presence of any adjacent whitespace
the element bearing this attribute is considered not to mark the end of any adjacent orthographic token irrespective of the presence of any adjacent whitespace
the encoding does not take any position on this issue.

targetLang.description: specifies the language of the content to be found at the destination referenced by target, using a language tag generated according to BCP 47.

evaluate.description: specifies the intended meaning when the target of a pointer is itself a pointer.

valList.desc: if the element pointed to is itself a pointer, then the target of that pointer will be taken, and so on, until an element is found which is not a pointer.
if the element pointed to is itself a pointer, then its target (whether a pointer or not) is taken as the target of this pointer.
no further evaluation of targets is carried out beyond that needed to find the element specified in the pointer's target.
for features omitted from transcription due to editorial policy

agent.description: in the case of text omitted because of damage, categorizes the cause of the damage, if it can be identified.

valList.desc: damage results from rubbing of the leaf edges
damage results from mildew on the leaf surface
damage results from smoke

start.description: indicates the location within a temporal alignment at which this element begins.

end.description: indicates the location within a temporal alignment at which this element ends.

dur.description: indicates the length of this element in time.

dur-iso.description: indicates the length of this element in time.

anchored.description: indicates whether the copy text shows the exact place of reference for the note.

targetEnd.description: points to the end of the span to which the note is attached, if the note is not embedded in the text at that point.

place.description: specifies where this item is placed.

valList.desc: below the line
at the foot of the page
in the margin (left, right, or both)
at the top of the page
on the opposite, i.e. facing, page
on the other side of the leaf
above the line
at the end of e.g. chapter or volume.
within the body of the text.
in a predefined space, for example left by an earlier scribe.

cause.description: documents the presumed cause for the intervention.

seq.description: assigns a sequence number related to the order in which the encoded features carrying this attribute are believed to have occurred.

notation.description: names the notation used for the content of the element.

mimeType.description: specifies the applicable multimedia internet mail extension (MIME) media type

cRef.description: specifies the destination of the pointer by supplying a canonical reference expressed using the scheme defined in a refsDecl element in the TEI header

label.description: provides a label (usually a single letter) to identify which part of a rhyme scheme this rhyming string instantiates.

function.description: characterizes the function of the segment.

datcat.description: contains a PID (persistent identifier) that aligns the given element with the appropriate Data Category (or categories) in ISOcat.

valueDatcat.description: contains a PID (persistent identifier) that aligns the content of the given element or the value of the given attribute with the appropriate simple Data Category (or categories) in ISOcat.

force.description: indicates the extent to which this punctuation mark conventionally separates words or phrases

valList.desc: the punctuation mark is a word separator
the punctuation mark is not a word separator
the punctuation mark may or may not be a word separator

pre.description: indicates whether this punctuation mark precedes or follows the unit it delimits.

lemma.description: provides a lemma (base form) for the word, typically uninflected and serving both as an identifier (e.g. in dictionary contexts, as a headword), and as a basis for potential inflections.

lemmaRef.description: provides a pointer to a definition of the lemma for the word, for example in an online lexicon.

pos.description: (part of speech) indicates the part of speech assigned to a token (i.e. information on whether it is a noun, adjective, or verb), usually according to some official reference vocabulary (e.g. for German: STTS, for English: CLAWS, for Polish: NKJP, etc.).

msd.description: (morphosyntactic description) supplies morphosyntactic information for a token, usually according to some official reference vocabulary (e.g. for German: STTS-large tagset; for a feature description system designed as (pragmatically) universal, see Universal Features).

join.description: when present, it provides information on whether the token in question is adjacent to another, and if so, on which side. The definition of this attribute is adapted from ISO MAF (Morpho-syntactic Annotation Framework), ISO 24611:2012.

unitRef.description: points to a unique identifier stored in the xml:id of a unitDef element that defines a unit of measure.

commodity.description: indicates the substance that is being measured

full.description: indicates whether the name component is given in full, as an abbreviation or simply as an initial.

valList.desc: the name component is spelled out in full.
the name component is given in an abbreviated form.
the name component is indicated only by one initial.

sort.description: specifies the sort order of the name component in relation to others within the name.

nymRef.description: provides a means of locating the canonical form (nym) of the names associated with the object named by the element bearing it.

value.description: supplies the value of the number in standard form.

versionDate.description: specifies the date on which the source text was extracted and sent to the translator

enjamb.description: indicates that the end of a verse line is marked by enjambement.

valList.desc: the line is end-stopped
the line in question runs on into the next
the line is weakly enjambed
the line is strongly enjambed

usage.description: specifies the approximate percentage (by volume) of the text which uses this language.

columns.description: specifies the number of columns per page

streams.description: indicates the number of streams per page, each of which contains an independent textual stream

ruledLines.description: specifies the number of ruled lines per column

writtenLines.description: specifies the number of written lines per column

selector.description: contains a selector or series of selectors specifying the elements to which the contained style description applies, expressed in the language specified in the scheme attribute.

schemeVersion.description: supplies a version number for the style language provided in scheme.

gi.description: specifies the name (generic identifier) of the element indicated by the tag, within the namespace indicated by the parent namespace element.

occurs.description: specifies the number of occurrences of this element within the text.

withId.description: specifies the number of occurrences of this element within the text which bear a distinct value for the global xml:id attribute.

level.description: indicates the bibliographic level for a title, that is, whether it identifies an article, book, journal, series, or unpublished material.

valList.desc: the title applies to an analytic item, such as an article, poem, or other work published as part of a larger item.
the title applies to a monograph such as a book or other item considered to be a distinct publication, including single volumes of multi-volume works
the title applies to any serial or periodical publication such as a journal, magazine, or newspaper
the title applies to a series of otherwise distinct publications such as a collection
the title applies to any unpublished material (including theses and dissertations unless published by a commercial press)

scribe.description: gives a name or other identifier for the scribe believed to be responsible for this hand.

scribeRef.description: points to a full description of the scribe concerned, typically supplied by a person element elsewhere in the description.

script.description: characterizes the particular script or writing style used by this hand, for example secretary, copperplate, Chancery, Italian, etc.

scriptRef.description: points to a full description of the script or writing style used by this hand, typically supplied by a scriptNote element elsewhere in the description.

medium.description: describes the tint or type of ink, e.g. brown, or other writing medium, e.g. pencil
